Reviews.Title: “Could be Cleaner”
Reviews.Author: MellieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The location was great with fantastic little restaurants near by. It isn't far to Rome's best gelato and the sights of Rome are all within an easy walk. The room could have been cleaner and the beds comfortable - so I don't think it is up to the normal European 3 star standard - but the hotel staff were helpful and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate room, decent breakfast, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: werylone
Reviews.Content: I booked this over the internet and had to change my reservation several times when my mother and a friend decided to join me in Rome. Claudio at Hotel Tirreno answered my emails promptly and was very accommodating. The best thing about this Hotel is the location--walking distance from Termini but on a quiet street away from the Termini hotel frenzy. Very easy to walk to all the major sites in Rome. However, the room was dark and gloomy. The only window was around the side of the bathroom and did not let any light into the room. The bathroom was nicely tiled and fitted with toilet, bidet and standing shower. We had 2 twin beds that were OK and one extra bed that was just a step above a camp cot. But sleep comes easily when you've been out touring wherever you lay your head. Breakfast was good coffee and tea plus juice, corn flakes, pastries and a basket of packaged goods like biscuits and cookies. Nutella, butter, jams were provided to go with your croissants. Claudio was very nice and helpful as were the ladies who served breakfast. The other clerks were distracted and not very interested in being helpful. One night as my girlfriend and I were up late talking in the sitting room of the hotel (so as not to disturb my mother who was sleeping in the room) the Hotel Clerk asked us to leave so that he could close up. So it seems that the sitting room is only available for guest use during certain hours. Overall, this is an average hotel in a great location. Since I was not planning on being in the room other than to sleep it was fine for what I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ToTravel_10
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd review for a hotel in Rome. I would have liked to go again at Imperial Suite but the travel agency solved my accommodation so it was a surprise at what hotel I will land. I must admit that I am a little impressed with all the comments from tripadvisor. It is true that it is clean but it should be refurbished or redecorated and maybe renovated. It has an old flavor. It is not a new hotel or with new furniture. If you book at this hotel take care in what room you will stay. My room was an incredibly small one and when I asked for a bigger one they said that I should pay an extra amount. The bathroom was very very small and the doors from the shower were with stains of water. On the TV there were only Italian channels. The blanket that was on the bed it had to be washed. The breakfast consisted of coffee/tea, orange juice, butter/marmalade, 1 croissant & 1 small piece of bread and a basket with bought things (corn flakes,pies,biscuits). The breakfast didn't surprised me so much because this is the Italian breakfast as far as I know. Another problem was with the internet. Only till 23:00 o'clock you could have internet and only in the lobby. On short I am not sure if I would go back to this hotel. If they would refurbish it I am sure it would be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Avarege stay”
Reviews.Author: otubo
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, near trains station (Termini) and the subway. A few minutes away from the Coliseum. Staff a little rude, though.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very rude”
Reviews.Author: Marcelleramalho
Reviews.Content: The room is clean and is near the train station and the Colosseum. But the staff is very rude, you can use the wifi only until 23h or you will be adverted, the towels are very thin and the place doesn't look good. It's a good choice if you don't have enough money to stay in a better place.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Bert1111
Reviews.Content: very very quiet place, lovely private patio behind.

Reviews.Title: “the location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: israpes
Reviews.Content: we stayed in quadruple room which is big enough for four people. The hotel was five minute walk to the metro station. The breakfast was unusual for us. There was no cheese, no ham etc. There were only butter, jam and some crackers. the room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. There is also a minibar in the room. I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: irishRover100
Reviews.Content: Convenient to the station and metro. Queit and we thought it was clean, we always inspect the bed which was clean. Breakfast adequate and overall staff very helpful if a little distant at times. As I wasn't leaving till eventime I was allowed leave my bags, when I returned and before my journey I had spent all day in Rome's heat so I asked if I could have a shower which was very graciously given and for which I was very grateful. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gazzaguitar
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times and am always happy to return , very friendly staff who are always helpfull ,Very good location just a few blocks from Termini station and between 3 metro stops which are just a few mins walk . some great restaurants on the same street , The free WI-FI in the lobby worked great, and the mini bar was well stocked and very reasonable ,great hotel and great value for money , I will be back .

Reviews.Title: “best location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: adi0987
Reviews.Content: first of all, location location location!!! the best location i could have ask for. when i booked it i was abit scared that its closed to the tremini, which is not true, the hotel is 10 minutes walking Santa Maria Maggiore Basilica, the Colosseum and the Roman Forum. very nice staff, had answers for all our "tourists questions". we were 3 in the room, and i think that it was the most continent triple room we have ever been to (even in 4 star hotels). breakfast is not special, id say abit light, but for me the pastry and a cup of tea did the work perfectly. When ill go back to rome, defintly coming back to hotel Tirreno.

Reviews.Title: “Could be much better”
Reviews.Author: DanielBGX
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in a room just overlooking the "Tirreno" sign towards the street. Room was fine and clean. My advise is have a look at the rooms and then choose. A drawback is hotel does not have any good breakfast at all. They are giving some tea/coffee and cakes from the store. You can get cheese and butter but you have to ask for it. Major drawback is staff does not allow discount for returning customers. They also lack any information on renting scooters/cars. I think they have airport transport, but generally they are at a pretty good location. Was good they kept our bags before we checked in. Prices vary very much depending on the days of stay coinciding with Vatican's Christian Holidays. Sometimes then the metro closes too early, e.g. Christmas and Easter so you would appreciate the possibility of even walking from Vatican to the hotel. Bathroom was very small, shower compartment was too tight, so I took really good care not to damage anything while I was showering. There was wifi only in the lobby. Generally good one, but could be so much better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “An opinion from the middle of the spectrum - great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruce_Sheila_youngun
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 weeks in London, Rome, Paris and Lucerne and have decided to comment/review on all hotels on our trip from someone who had a normal experience - ie nothing extraordinary happened here and hence you probably would not mention too much to your friends and colleagues afterwards. We stayed 6 nights in room 201 which is a triple room on the back corner of the building with windows on two sides providing great ventilation, and an a/c unit which we did not use. The room was not overly large, but equal in size to all other triple hotel rooms we stayed in during our travels. The bathroom was spacious and good with windows on two sides, and there was sufficient cupboard space to empty two of our 3 carry-on sized suitcases. The third suitcase was conveniently slipped under the bed for storage during the 23.9 hours a day it was not being used. The little bar fridge was adequate to store our survival kit of chocolates and beer, and we found BBC World News to watch on the TV. We never heard any other guests whilst in our room, with the exception of one couple chatting whilst getting out of the lift one night. The staff at the front desk were always friendly and helpful and willing to speak english with us. When emailed direct, the reservations manager was quite happy to give me another nights accomodation after I had made a mistake in my booking.com booking and it was showing no availabilty for my extra day. Breakfast was a Continental breakfast. It filled us all up for our exciting day ahead, and was served by the lovely ladies in the dining room (Italian speaking) - cappuchino included. My 9yo son was also very chuffed to have hot chocolate every morning and over the moon when he found the individual serves of Nutella in our breakfast basket - I had never seen a croissant with nutella spread all over the outside of it until then. There are some restaurants in the same street - less than 50m away , which we dined at for most nights - special mention to the restaurant "Il Nizza" (I think thats its name) which provided good , honest food at reasonable prices (menu Touristico was 10 euro) and run by a young couple who were nice,genuine honest people. The location was excellent , only 10 minutes walk from Termini station, and like some people we had difficulty finding it the first time - I put it down to my Southern Hemisphere navigational skills (which sometimes dont work too well in N.Hemisphere) as the street was on my map. We managed to walk to the attractions most days, and only favoured the Metro for trips to the Vatican area. Overall, we all enjoyed staying at this hotel and would stay there next time we go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: Adrian1725
Reviews.Content: Do not take any notice of the photos on the hotels website or any other website such as booking.com etc. I have travelled the world and stayed in every type of hotel possible but this is the worst I have ever stayed in. It is supposed to be a 3 star but I think they just classed themselves as a 3 star. This would not get even one star in England! The bed was the size of a small childs bed and their was a wardrobe that wouldjust fit a few t shirts in. The room hardly had room to put my suitcase on the floor. I certainly couldn't walk past it. The room was also so hot and the air conditioning didn't work. My friend also stayed in another room and had exactly the same experience. When we askedvery politely to change room it was not possible, they were all the same and nobody ever complains! I was also told if I didn't like it then to move out and find somewhere else!! The rooms in all hotels in Rome are smaller than average and also expensive but this was just unbelieveable. I have never been dealt with in such an arrogant way ever by the manager Claudio. I would rather sleep in a tent than stay in this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - within walking distance to train station”
Reviews.Author: Chrissie-on-Rails
Reviews.Content: Stayed there just for 4 nights - single room was very small, only Italian channels on TV. Breakfast could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel on perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hubert0031
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, fine staff and a very good location for seeing the city. We liked it very much.

Reviews.Title: “friendly, basic, clean and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: eveirg
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel,it was walking distance to most attractions. Basic rooms but clean and well looked after by staff. All the staff were friendly and welcoming. Breakfast was better than expected. At night after a long day site seeing we were able to sit in the garden area drinking while the children were tucked up in bed. If I was to visit Rome again I would consider staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Whatta dump!”
Reviews.Author: bettyborde
Reviews.Content: We booked our room over telephone. When we arrived, the desk clerk took our passports and a credit card. We were shown to our room. We stayed about 15 minutes. It was noisy, dingy, and had a bad smell coming from a vent. We decided not to stay, but the manager would not refund our money; he said we had "used" the room because we admitted to sitting in chairs! Incredible. We filed a complaint with the nearest TI office. They were shocked at the rates and at our treatment. The Tirreno manager said we had to come back later and talk to his superior. We made a total of three trips back before we gave up on getting a refund. Luckily, we found a hotel not far away with a nice room. My sister and brother in law were staying at the Tirreno at the same time. Their room was much nicer though not great. They had booked it with AAA. Perhaps there are "good" and "bad" rooms at this hotel. At any rate, we feel our money should have been cheerfully refunded. Upon returning home, we were able to get a refund from the credit card company ,but a lot of time and energy were spent in trying to rectify a bad situation.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: FiveToItaly
Reviews.Content: This was our only disappointing hotel on our trip to Italy. We chose the location because it was near the Colosseum, which was the only plus since it was a 10 minute walk. It was also close to the subway stop which we used a couple of times (once to get to Vatican City and once home from Spanish steps). We had a family suite. The windows were near the top of the wall so we had to stand on a chair to open them. Then we had a view of the knees of people walking on the patio, and they had a clear view down into our room. So we ended up keeping the windows shut all the time. The air conditioner dripped water all night. We mentioned it to front desk but nothing was fixed so we laid towels underneath every night. The hotel overall is dull and dingy, the carpets were filthy. The street it is located on is narrow and home to a couple of tiny bars. We didn't hear any noise but nonetheless I wasn't crazy about walking out at night. The breakfast consisted of pre-packaged croissants, cereal, cheese slices (wrapped like Kraft slices). The service was abrupt. This was really disappointing especially after the excellent food at our previous hotel (Il Nido Ristorante in Sorrento). If you do stay, there is a great pizza place on the corner and shwarma place around the corner. Both had good food and reasonable prices. I would not stay at this place again, but I would choose a different hotel in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: Psychobeth
Reviews.Content: Since last year was our third year at the Tirreno, it's obvious we enjoy it. The location is wonderful, the rooms clean and nice and the staff is wonderful - especially Marco and Massimo. The small street the hotel is on is quiet and I've walked up the street late at night alone to the bar on the corner of the Via Merulana and felt perfectly safe - safer, in fact, than I'd feel walking in my residential neighborhood at home. The hotel is close to two different metro stations and within walking distance to several restaurants - even one that's open on Sunday night. I enjoy the continental breakfast and have not had any problem getting my morning espresso with breakfast. My favorite room is 101. It has the tiny corner shower, but more than makes up for it by having a private garden with table, chairs and a fountain. It's nice to get bread, cheese and wine at the Elite grocery down the Via Cavour and enjoying it in the garden. Any leftovers can be kept in the little refrigerator for the next day. Would I stay there again? You betcha. In fact, I've stayed there four times out of the last five years.

Reviews.Title: “Location fine but hotel terrible”
Reviews.Author: MarkK54
Reviews.Content: Had stayed in 3 star hotel in Florence which was fabulous and a 4 star hotel in Perugia which was even better so expected something similar in Rome - especially as the Hotel Tirreno was the most expensive of the three hotels during our holiday. However, while the location is OK, it is central albeit up a dingy side street, and 5 minutes from the train station the hotel itself was a grave disappointment. The room was so small I was considering leaving my bag on the grimmy balcony as there was no room for it in the room bar on the bed or in the bathroom! The walls were paper thin and the TV channels worked intermittently. The breakfast was pathetic to say the least with corn flakes and pre-packed European desserts. I had to ask several times each morning for a bowel for the cereal and the coffee was served in a silver saucepan which was somewhat bizarre! If there is nowhere else stay here but in the UK this hotel would be a one sstar at best. The plus, bathroom fine and Irish bar in the street does a good pint of Guiness! Don't know how the last review gave it 5 stars. The reviewer must have been in prison and considered the room in the hotel 5 stars when compared with his previous accomodation! Won't go back to the Tirreno if I got a free trip, Mark

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Eero
Reviews.Content: I travelled Rome - Firenze - Rome in July 2008. When returning to Rome I spent 3 nights at Tirreno hotel. In Rome and Firenze I stayed in 3 different hotels and Tirreno was the best experience. The hotel has a very good but a quiet location in the very heart of Rome. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, air conditioned and had a commodious bathroom with bath. A nice breakfast was served in a good sized breakfast room. The breakfast was included. I walked a lot in the city of Rome so it was just wonderful to take a bath every evening. I can recommend this hotel and if I ever visit Rome again, I will doubtless stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dump”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddyFlorida
Reviews.Content: Family just got back from rome and stayed 2 nights in this hotel and I would not recommend any americans to stay here. Not very nice people at desk and rooms were a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: CFCCharleston_SC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled from Rome to Venice. We stayed at the Tirreno 3 nights in April. It set the bar for the rest of the hotels we stayed at during the next 10 days. The front desk staff was helpful and friendly. The breakfast was very good. The room was small but all we needed, and it opened onto a private terrazo. It was also in a great location for the local Metro train and the main line terminal between cities. We plan to visit Rome again next year and this is the hotel where we will be staying. Wouldn't consider any other.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: LHMB
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay at Tirreno hotel. Overall experience was good. This hotel is centrally located in a quiet side street very close to 2 metro stations and about a 10min walk to the Termini. The hotel itself is fine - there is nothing extra-ordinary about the place but it is clean and central. Breakast is average - croissants and tea/coffee. There is a lovely terrace garden which is very quiet and relaxing. Our room was quite small but that didn't bother us as we didn't really have much luggage, we did however have a balcony which was great to sit out on. The room also had a much needed air con system. All in all, i would happily stay in this hotel again if i was back in Rome, and would recommend it to friends and family as a good mid-price hotel but it would not automatically be my number one choice for Rome. It is also worth mentioning that they did giveus 5% discount for paying cash.

Reviews.Title: “Tirreno - friendly clean good value”
Reviews.Author: Spider5
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in January. Two adults and three teenagers. It was a breath of fresh air after being in Paris. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful, they even gave us a tourist map and highlighted it with suggestions without being asked. We were given a family room which opened onto a garden. It was more like a small apartment. Lovely. Breakfast is very good. Everybody we dealt with in the hotel was friendly and helpful. they all smiled. Excellent location. Only 10 mins walk from the Colosseum. A great pizza place 20m down the road and a choice of restaurants around the corner. If I go back to Rome I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location not what they say”
Reviews.Author: norwegianadventurer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Tirreno in Rome. After spending several days in Italy prior to my arrival, I was really dissappointed with the overall condition of the rooms. The beds were terribly uncomfortable! And there was no hot water for showers, unless you got up at the crack of dawn. On the website it staes that it is centrally located, however, get ready to walk 20 minutes to get to any of the tourist locations. The metro station is close by, if you are up to navigating the metro rail system. I would only stay here as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: D_____Mpls
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week in a 2 bedroom one bath room for 265 euros a night. The price seemed a bit high for what we got but that may be the going rate in Rome I guess. There is a big breakfast room with free continental breakfast which is nice. It was clean and has an elevator. The location is OK - between the train station and the Coluseeum and near santa maria maggiori church. They do accept credit cards but charge a 5% extra fee.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: GreenstoneGirl
Reviews.Content: Just finished our stay at Tirreno and can report that it is a very good place to stay. We had a very clean, large room, overlooking the street below but because it is a little side street, it is very quiet at night, once you close the window. Very large bathroom, looked liked it had been recently redone, all the mod cons. Breakfast is the basic continental offering, but if you ask for cappucino or latte they will make it for you on their espresso machine. We loved the little restaurant just up the street, they offer a buffet for €7 that includes about 15 choices from grilled eggplant to stuffed pasta, excellent food and great service. The staff at the restaurant and at the hotel, all speak English and are very helpful. Although its about a mile or so from Termini it is very safe area, I am an older woman and felt quite safe out on the streets in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok.......not great...but ok.”
Reviews.Author: haymont
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Tirrenno for four nights in mid - December 2006 and our first impressions were not great. We were early so couldn't check in till after 2pm and when we returned to check in we found our room (on the 4th floor) to be completely smoky and the bathroom smelled as though somone had died in there then they used heavy duty cleaning solution to disinfect it! As we were so tired we thought we could air the room out by opening the balcony doors while we had a sleep for a couple of hours....no such luck. After just over two hours in the room we were both choked up from the smoke and cleaning products stench that we couldn't breathe even with the doors wide open. I'm asthmatic and didn't want to cause a fuss but there was no way I could stay in the room. We went down and told the front desk of our problem and were told 'everybody smokes' even though it was supposed to be a non smoking room, and 'what can we do?' i asked if we could change and we were given the key to another room (303) to see if it was acceptable...it stil smelled of smoke but not as bad as the other room and no chlorine stench either so we swapped rooms immediately. This room was about 1/2 the size of the previous one but for our lungs sake we didn't care. The breakfast at the hotel was pretty average...a couple of stale bread rolls and a crossiant and the usual mini toasts and crackers. Coffee that was like thick sludge. other partons were offered esspresso but we weren't. When we asked she said 'no espresso'...weird. We went out for breakfast every other morning. On a good note the little restaurant almost across the road I think it's called 'nipitino de solitarno' or something to that effect is fantastic! The pasta, bruschetta, pizza, wine and everything we ate there was fantastic and we never paid more than 30 euros for our dinner. On the whole the location was ok....the walk to the termini is easy but that area is a bit shady after dark. The street the hotel is on is pretty cool with little bars and clubs/pubs etc We wouldn't stay there again but opt for something closer to main center etc

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: flinny
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tirreno for 2 nights and got a good deal with Expedia. Our room was small but perfectly adequate and spotlessly clean and warm in January. The beds were comfortable and the room very quiet with no traffic noise at all. The small narrow street may be off putting on first sight but we felt very safe and comfortable returning in the dark. The hotel is very convenient for the Termini station and we were able to walk to all the main sights in Rome. Breakfast was simple but welcome and the staff were very eager to please. Overall we were very happy with the hotel and the two small restaurants opposite were exceedingly cheap and excellent value for money. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “New years at Tirreno”
Reviews.Author: Cdes
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 3 night say in Tirreno 30 Dec 06-2 Jan 07. On arrival (got a taxi from Ciam airport €50!!!) directly to the door, it was 01:00am, was greeted by Georgio who had been waiting for us. Asked if it was our first time in rome (yes) and he produced a colourful map with all the sights, the metro lines and stops, gave us advise on pick pocketers on the no 63 bus to St Peters...all in all very helpful. We stayed in an apartment on our first night and were then moved to room 102...the room with no window in your room...it was down a little alcove off the room!!so the room was a bit stuffy.The room itself was very clean the bathroom a bit cramped and the towels very thin.The breakfast again from reading the other reviews very basic..nice coffee though.The hotel is ideal for a place to rest your head when sight seeing..no frills attached!....very close to the metro and nice resturants at the door..the chinese is the "best in Rome" speciality Black Rice!! yum yum :-)...oh the TV in the room could do with some more english channels..in summary it was alright.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: landsnark
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff were warm and helpful, and (we were grateful for this) had good English. The room was very clean, comfortable and quiet, and the location was perfect for us, an easy walk from the train station and most of the tourist sites (though we did take the Metro to Vatican/St. Peter's.) The hotel is on a small street so there was little traffic or road noise, and we felt quite safe walking in the area at night (some of the areas closer to Termini seemed less comfortable for outsiders.) Breakfast was excellent, and there are many nearby gelaterias, trattorias, etc. The room was a few degrees warm for our tastes, but we opened our balcony door when we came in for the evening. There really was nothing to complain or warn about. Without a doubt we would stay at this property again and would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in Rome”
Reviews.Author: SFPilgrim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I began our trip to Italy with a 5 night stay at the Tirreno. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the room was spotless. We traveled by train, so the location near the station was really convenient for arrival and departure. One word of caution: we had a room with a window facing the garden. The garden terrace was open 24 hours, so the noise coming from guests not eager to end their evening (I'm talking about 2 am) was a little annoying at times. Otherwise, it was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PeteCullen
Reviews.Content: A party of 7 of us stayed at the Tirreno from October 9 to October 12.We chose it because of the good price and the excellent location, 10 minutes from Termini station and a similar distance from the Colosseum. We were not disappointed! The hotel rooms were spotlessly clean, with all necessary amenities. The staff were friendly and efficient. The hotel is in a quiet street which has two good restaurants, especially the pizzeria opposite which does excellent pizzas for 5 euros, and a litre of house wine for 6 euros. There are also a couple of good bars in the street. There are lots of other good restaurants nearby. My only slight grumble would be the breakfast, which is a bit basic, but not bad. All in all, if you want a reasonably cheap hotel in a convenient location for the sites of Rome, you would find it hard to beat the Tirreno.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, Comfortable, Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelByC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Tirreno September 23-26, 2006 as a group of 8. Previous reviews in TripAdvisor mirrored our experience: -the rooms are spotless, -bathrooms large and clean, -room sizes very large from our experience, -loved the towels used by the hotel (admittedly, they are cotton but dried quickly and were replaced daily), -location is great; within 10 minutes walk to the colosseum, -plenty of restaurants, gelati :) and shopping nearby, -staff (particularly Georgio) were awesome, -breakfast perfectly adequate (the croissants were yum!), -patio area lovely in the evening, -reasonable cost for Rome (we paid $215 per night during high season). My only complaint (which was easily remedied by closing the windows) was the noise of the bar across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2jayhawks
Reviews.Content: We came to the Hotel Tirreno after a miserable experience at another hotel. We went to the hotel reservation service at the train station to find a hotel after a lousy experience with a hotel booked from the travel agent. They give us a very small room initially, but asked if we liked the room. We didn't but let it go. When we come back from dinner, Giorgio (what a sweetie) could tell that I really didn't like the room and offered the next day to switch us to a bigger room. We were stunned! Our previous experience was with a nasty hotel who didn't even offer to change anything after we complained. Plus the room had a tub, which I insisted on. Giorgio was so great he directed us to dinner, and told us to use his name for a discount! He gave us recommendations on how to get around and was all around fantastic. The neat thing about the hotel is you are in the middle of the two metro lines Cavour down the street and Victtorio Emmanuel up the street and around the corner. Giorgio also gave us the heads up on taxis--dont! they rip you off. The next day, we went sightseeing using the metro and our Rick Steves guide. Here's a tip--take the metro to Cavour and go to Colloseo (I think it is only one stop away), when you get out of the station look across the street and be blown away. We then returned to the room which they gave us three choices. We finally picked room 101 which is a big room with its own little patio and shade tree--a lovely spot for a glass of wine at the end of long day of walking. Fantastic! I loved this hotel and would recommend anyone to stay there. Thanks Giorgio, Luisa, and all the staff..

Reviews.Title: “Geat find”
Reviews.Author: TheMcColes
Reviews.Content: Our friends with whom we were travelling in late April set a very low limit on the cost of hotel rooms. I chose the Tirreno mainly because the price was right and the reviews were okay. I expected a room for under $200 in Rome would be a bit on the seedy side. We were delighted to find that our expectations were off the mark. Our room and bathroom was very clean and modern. The shower was just like at home with great water pressure. Although the rooms were small by American standards, the French doors leading to a large balcony made the bedroom seem larger. There was a table and chairs on the balcony and we sat out there with our friends evey afternoon and enjoyed the peacefulness. The hotel was very quiet and we slept with the French doors open each night. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They always greeted you with a smile and provided guidance on what to do and directions. Breakfast was typical continental. Since this was our first trip to Rome, we reserved the hotel limo service for pickup at the airport. The driver was waiting for us with a sign with our name on it and he whisked us and our baggage right to the hotel. I would recommend you do this if you are unfamiliar with Rome or don't like having to wait in lines for a taxi. The ristorante and pizzaria just across the street from the hotel do have limited menus, but the food is great and you can't beat the prices. Best pizza ever. The hotel's location is great. On a side street away from the crowds but close enough to walk to public transportation or the sights. We walked to almost all of the places we visited and easily found our way back home by using Santa Maria Maggiore as our landmark. I would highly recommend Hotel Tirreno and would stay there again when we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Babinos
Reviews.Content: The location is very good. Colosseum and the Forum 10-15 minutes walk from there and the Metro is one minute away. Termini is at the same distance as Colosseum. I’ve walked to the city centre on 2 out of 3 days there. The other day I went to Vatican by Metro and that was in total 20-25 minutes.The hotel is located in a quiet alley. Despite the comments of some other users, I didn’t have any problem with sound except on Sunday hearing the bells from the near by church and that was late in the morning. The staff is friendly and the room was small but adequate, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the big chains!”
Reviews.Author: Scallie
Reviews.Content: I moved to this hotel having spent the previous four nights at a hotel just off the Via Veneto, which was double the price. Surprisingly, the Hotel Tirreno was twice as nice. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff friendly. It's also extremely conveniently located, being just a stone's throw from a metro station and within walking distance of the Roman Forum. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kenato
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop in Italy and we were suitably impressed after reading reviews of tiny rooms and no hot water for many locations. Our room in the Tirreno was large (think it was a triple) and the bathroom had tub with shower and plenty of hot water. I am 6' 4" and bed was big enough for me and wife. Only problem was we were on the front of hotel and it was noisy at night with window open. Bar and club stay open till early morning and in narrow cobbled street sound is emphasized. Would certainly ask for room not on front if visited again. Breakfast was a bit repetitive with rolls and croissants but choice of cereals and biscuits available. Staff were very friendly and helpful with restaurant suggestions. (Restaurant and Pizzarea on street are very good but don't have set menu at restaurant) Very convenient for station and a 20 min walk to many attractions if you don't get lost!!! Would stay again, in back room. Ken

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Tony1702
Reviews.Content: Located mid way between Termini and Colliseum, side street with with 2 decent restaurants and 2 Irish style bars. Accomodation small but clean and more than adequate for the 4 nights we spent there. After walking in Rome for hours it was great to have food and drink within 50 metres of the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Spicy2006
Reviews.Content: Very good value for the price! We stayed on the 4th floor and the only problem was that the shower would go burning hot and then cold every minute or so. We learned later that this was a problem only on the 4th floor, so we recommend that you get a room on another floor. We only stayed one night on a lay-over flight back to Canada, but we found the staff genuinely friendly and helpful. This is definately a good hotel for the price (we paid 85 Euros for one night, double occupancy, breakfast included) and the location. We walked to the Colleseum and took a Green Line Bus Tour of the city by nightfall from 7-9pm.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Little Accident.”
Reviews.Author: ucmedaa.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for eight nights early Sept 05 and really enjoyed it. Booked by mistake as we got the names mixed up. Room was on the top floor and had a balcony and air conditioning. Good size, very clean and the balcony was so private one could sunbathe in the nutty. Excellent shower and loads of hot water. Bar across the road was audible but never a problem until about 10-30 and then went quiet. We slept like logs every night in the very comfortable beds. Staff were above average by a long way. Breakfast totally adequate and served in a pleasant dining room. Hotel is in a side street which has several eateries and other small businesses. Walk from Termini, to Maggiore Church, down Merulana and second right between a cafe and a sweet shop. Big SMA supermarket in a basement opposite the front door of the Maggiore Church was very handy as it is cheap for essentials. Budget eating with kids, try the Chef Express self service top left in Termini concourse. (Not the small one on the right) They do'nt mind if you pick up a couple of empty plates. One negative, air conditioning in 404 was noisy but I expect that is fixed by now. Would I stay there again, I certainly would.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tirreno, Via San Martino ai Monti 18, 00184 Roma Italy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had to write a quick review to say this hotel was excellent. Really enjoyed myself there. It was 110 euro approx for a twin room. Rooms were more than basic and spotlessly clean. One of our group said that there twin room was a little small but apart from that there were no complaints. The location is excellent. It is a 10-12 minute walk to the Colleseum, Forum and the Termini bus station. The Vatican does requires a taxi ride there but it is not that expensive. The staff were very friendly. The breakfast was a typical continental breakfast of cereal, bread coffee, croisant etc. Appartently the coffee was not great but thats only a little thing. For overall value I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Tirreno for 7 nights in May, 2005. I had a wonderful room, with patio, on the 3rd floor front. It was very quiet for Rome. The room was newly refurbished, very clean, and quite comfortable. The staff were very helpful and friendly during my staff. Service in the breakfast room was particularly nice with a "good morning," fresh rolls, blood orange juice, and choice of beverage. The hotel is located on a quaint little street one minute from Santa Maria Maggiore and 10 minutes from Stazione Termini. One of the nice benefits of the location is the proxity to the beautiful church of Santa Prassede, just down the street. I would definitely stay there again during my 4th trip to Rome. I selected the hotel from the positive comments on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: goin2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome and if you staying at the Tirreno definitely bring earplugs. We brought earplugs but the noise still kept us up all 3 nights of our stay. There is a bar located just across from the hotel and they party until 4:00am. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was ok. The staff was not all that helpful. The location is good close to train station and the sights. If the noise was eliminated I would rate this hotel much higher.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price OK location”
Reviews.Author: KMMRAM
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tirreno based upon reviews on the Trip Advisor. Price was reasonable and location were a plus as we came from Florence by train and the Tirreno was close to the station. Room and bath were clean and nighttime street noise was minimal eventhough some recent Trip Advisor reviews mentioned this may be a problem. It was not at least for us. Breakfast was the typical rolls and cereal and was just OK in my book. The desk clerks and staff were pleasant and helpful. There were no surpises on the bill. There were several local tartorria's that were very nice and reasonably price. On prior trips to Rome we stayed at hotels near the Via Veneto or Vatican and personally I liked that part of town because the night life is easier to reach, but since I needed three rooms this trip I had to make sure the room price didn't break the bank so we made some trade-offs. All-in-all the Tirreno was a nice hotel in a OK location at the right price. P.S. If the church four doorways or so down the street from the Tirreno is open I suggest you stop in, what a gem, built in 1100's, full of mosaics of that period.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: BethCagnol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is advertised as having three stars. Sorry, but it is not even a one star in my book: the room was dirty, the bed was too soft, the toilet ran all night, and they don’t know the difference between bathroom towels and kitchen towels. There is absolutely no carpeting therefore the room and the hallways resonate with every footstep, every passing conversation, every turn of the key and every shutting of the door. To top it off, the side street is extremely noisy with bar and scooter noise. The good points are the location, the friendly staff and the cappuccino. Bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ward2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect: close to all the hot sights (colloseum, forum, etc.), a very friendly neighbourhood, very friendly staff, and very low price. My girlfriend and I stayed there for 3 nights. We walked to all the famous sights. I would really go there again if I would go to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate with alley entrance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, reasonably priced; althought 13 euros extra each day for air conditioning. Breakfast sub-standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: daviest1
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Tirreno Hotel, very friendly and helpful, nothing was ever too much trouble. The rooms were in excellent condition, very clean and comfortable. The location was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “A good moderately priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The airport reservation desk found the four of us this hotel after problems with our reservation elsewhere. At the hotel, Massimo the desk clerk made us feel at home with a cup of coffee and went out of his way to ensure we wouldn't have problems with the other (cancelled) booking. We had the rear two storey building which has a double on the ground and first floors. The usual tiled floors, cotton towels you find everywhere in Italy. The room was spacious, very quiet with a lovely outlook over the rear garden. The beds are nice and firm. The breakfast consists of the usual bread rolls, croissants, coffee AND a choice of cereal - quite OK. The hotel will recommend a restaurant over the road on the corner, and we found it quite good - not overpriced and with friendly staff. Would I stay here again? Yes, - the rear facing rooms are best. The hotel is well located near the Colloseum and not too far from the main station, but far enough to be away from the grot. We were here in May 2004.

HotelInfo.Name: Tirreno Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via San Martino ai Monti 18, 00184 Rome, Italy
